critique: This document is an executive order issued by President Lyndon B. Johnson in 1967. It creates a board to investigate disputes between railway carriers and their employees, invoking the Railway Labor Act. The order aims to prevent interruption of interstate commerce and essential transportation services. It doesn't directly address immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. It also doesn't seem to expand executive power significantly, as it's based on existing legislation. The order seems to be a moderate intervention in economic matters to ensure the smooth functioning of essential services. It doesn't appear to favor either state or federal control significantly.
